title: 6 brilliant stats as Manchester City save FIFTH consecutive penalty in Champions League in thriller with Monaco
text:
6 brilliant stats as Manchester City save FIFTH consecutive penalty in Champions League in thriller with Monaco Goals, penalty saves, goalkeeping howlers, and records broken all over the shop... Share A game to remember for all the right reasons (Photo: Getty) Share Get daily     
What. A. Game. 
Manchester City beat Monaco 5-3 in the first leg of their Champions League last 16 knockout tie at the Etihad Stadium in a game that had absolutely everything. 
There were stunning goals, penalty saves, goalkeeping howlers and an ever-changing score line that favoured both sides at one point or another. 
As you'd probably expect following a game played at such a high calibre there were a number of fascinating stats that emerged off the back of it. 
Below we have compiled some of the best courtesy of the one and only Opta. Manchester City's 5-3 win over Monaco is the highest scoring first-leg ever in a Champions League knockout tie. Manchester City celebrate their 5-3 win (Photo: Stu Forster) Monaco have conceded five goals for the very first time in the Champions League. Sergio Aguero in action with Monaco's Andrea Raggi (Photo: Reuters) Manchester City have scored five goals in a Champions League game for the second time. They previously scored five against CSKA Moscow in 2013. Leroy Sane scored his side's fifth in the eight-goal thriller at the Etihad (Photo: Reuters) Falcao scored as many goals tonight (two) in Manchester as he did during 15 games playing for Manchester United at Old Trafford. Radamel Falcao made Man United fans very happy with his two goals (Photo: Reuters) Sergio Aguero's equaliser was Manchester City's 200th goal in Europe. Aguero celebrates getting back into Pep Guardiola's good books (Photo: REUTERS) And finally, our favourite... Manchester City have saved the last five penalties they have faced in the Champions League.
